title: Baby-blue theme updates: Home feature box placement, baby-blue coral reef backgrounds, and enhanced Fishing Zone search + map highlighting

requirements.text: Update the Home page feature-box section so there is a dedicated "Fishing Zone" feature box placed beside the existing "Comment" box on desktop/tablet layouts, while keeping the existing header navigation and its behavior unchanged.

quotes: in home page there should be Fishing zone box should be placed beside  comment.

acceptanceCriteria: On the Home page, a "Fishing Zone" card/box is visible in the feature-box section.
On >= md breakpoints, the "Fishing Zone" card is positioned adjacent to (beside) the "Comment" card (same row).
Clicking the "Fishing Zone" card CTA navigates to the existing Fishing Zone page via the existing onNavigate('fishing-zone') flow.
Existing top navigation buttons and routing behavior remain unchanged.

requirements.text: Switch the Fishing Zone page UI theme to a baby-blue color scheme (background, cards, buttons, and text styling) while preserving the existing layout sections (close button, search card, results cards, and map section).

quotes: Fishing zone page theme should be baby blue in color.

acceptanceCriteria: Fishing Zone page background uses a baby-blue forward palette (not the current dark ocean gradient).
Primary interactive elements (Search button, headings, cards) visually match the baby-blue theme and remain readable with sufficient contrast.
The close (X) button remains top-right and functional.

requirements.text: Replace the Home page coral reef background with new baby-blue coral reef background imagery, updating the existing global background class usage without changing unrelated styling or navigation behavior.

quotes: change  the backgoround image i need baby blue theme coral reef  background images.

acceptanceCriteria: Home page uses the newly generated baby-blue coral reef background image via the existing .coral-reef-home-bg class (or equivalent) with correct file path under frontend/public/assets/generated.
The background remains cover/centered and does not break existing layout spacing or header/footer placement.
No changes are made to unrelated pages' layouts/navigation as part of this update.

requirements.text: Enhance Fishing Zone search so users can search for seas, oceans, cities, and districts; after a successful search, display the matched entity type (Sea/Ocean/City/District) and highlight the searched location on the map with a red pointer.

quotes: in fishing zone page if i search sea,ocean,city and district should also be shown and searched sea,ocean,city and district should be hightlighter using red color pointer.

acceptanceCriteria: Fishing Zone search accepts names for seas/oceans (existing dataset), plus cities and districts (added datasets or extended existing datasets).
When a match is found, the results area clearly shows the matched location name and its type: Sea, Ocean, City, or District.
The map view shows a red pointer/marker at the matched location coordinates.
If the input does not match any known sea/ocean/city/district, the user sees an English error message and no marker is placed.

requirements.text: Compute and present the Coral Reef Health Index on the Fishing Zone page based specifically on temperature, pH, oxygen level, and turbidity (using fetched values when available, otherwise clearly labeled estimates), and ensure the index calculation uses these four inputs consistently.

quotes: calculate coral reef health index based on temperature,ph ,oxygen level and turbidity

acceptanceCriteria: Fishing Zone page uses temperature, pH, oxygen level, and turbidity from fetchEnvironmentData() (or its fallbacks) to compute the Coral Health Index.
The UI displays the four input metric values used (temperature, pH, oxygen level, turbidity) along with whether each was estimated (when applicable).
The displayed Coral Health Index score and condition label remain consistent with the underlying heuristic computation.

requirements.text: On the Fishing Zone map, highlight at least one location representing "more fish presence" for the searched sea/ocean using a yellow pointer, derived from the computed fish availability/condition for the searched sea/ocean and shown simultaneously with the red searched-location pointer.

quotes: hightlight the particular location or place  of presence of more fish level in that sea or ocean in same map itself with yellow color pointer.

acceptanceCriteria: After searching a sea/ocean, the map shows a yellow pointer/marker indicating a fish-presence hotspot derived from the computed fish availability/condition.
The red pointer (searched location) and yellow pointer (fish hotspot) can be visible at the same time and are visually distinct.

If the user searches for a City or District (not a sea/ocean), the app either does not show a fish hotspot marker or clearly indicates in English that fish hotspot highlighting applies to seas/oceans only (no crashes).

requirements.text: Update the Fishing Zone map rendering from a static image-only display to a marker-capable map component (using existing bundled map assets/components) so it can render the required red and yellow pointers at latitude/longitude coordinates without introducing new backend services.

quotes: searched sea,ocean,city and district should be hightlighter using red color pointer... in same map itself with yellow color pointer.

acceptanceCriteria: The Fishing Zone page map section renders markers based on coordinates (lat/lng) rather than being a purely static, non-interactive image.
The map continues to use existing bundled map assets/components already present in the codebase (no external map SDK requirement).
Marker rendering works for both searched location (red) and fish hotspot (yellow).

constraints: Do not modify files under frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx, or anything under frontend/src/components/ui (compose instead of editing).
Respect the single-actor backend architecture; no additional backend canisters/services.
Keep changes scoped to the requested Home page layout update, background imagery updates, and Fishing Zone theme/search/map behavior; do not refactor unrelated pages or navigation.
Use English for any user-facing text.
nonGoals: Adding third-party map providers (e.g., Google Maps SDK) or real-time services.
Implementing a new backend data store or changing backend state (current backend is empty and should remain unchanged for this request).
Adding authentication changes beyond the existing Internet Identity integration.

required: Baby-blue coral reef underwater background with softer gradient space for foreground UI (baby-blue-coral-reef-fishing-zone-bg.dim_2400x1600.png)
